page.title: 05Buildings
page.content: The distribution of buildings is mainly on the lower valley sides above the flood-plain of the Cynon, mostly following the natural contour pattern of the landscape or along the major roads in the linear formation. Most of the buildings are residential, either private or council houses. On the western side of the valley are typical rows of terraced houses built quickly during the rise of coal mining in South Wales.These houses are built mainly from the local Pennant Sandstone rock. New council houses are present, but appear to have a wider distribution on the eastern side of the valley. Besides houses flats are common. Private houses and other buildings tend to be located away from the Phurnacite, on the sunnier eastern side of the valley.
